description: Combined user stories from all PRDs in prd/ folder

userStories.title: US-001.1: As a CallVault user, I want the Import button at the top of the sidebar so that I can quickly access the primary action without searching.
userStories.description: US-001.1: As a CallVault user, I want the Import button at the top of the sidebar so that I can quickly access the primary action without searching.
acceptanceCriteria: Import button appears at top when sidebar expanded
Import button appears at top when sidebar collapsed
Visual separator between Import and nav items
Collapsed sidebar shows left-side orange pill on active item
Works for all nav items (Home, Chat, Content, etc.)

userStories.title: US-003.1: As a CallVault user, I want Analytics to appear before Settings in the sidebar so that I can access my call analytics more easily.
userStories.description: US-003.1: As a CallVault user, I want Analytics to appear before Settings in the sidebar so that I can access my call analytics more easily.
acceptanceCriteria: Analytics appears above Settings in nav
Settings is the last nav item

userStories.title: US-004.1: As a CallVault user, I want Settings at the bottom of the navigation so that its in the expected location and doesnt distract from primary features.
userStories.description: US-004.1: As a CallVault user, I want Settings at the bottom of the navigation so that its in the expected location and doesnt distract from primary features.
acceptanceCriteria: Settings is the last nav item
No visual separation from other nav items

userStories.title: US-005.1: As a CallVault user with many folders, I want proper spacing around the search box so that the interface feels polished and easy to scan.
userStories.description: US-005.1: As a CallVault user with many folders, I want proper spacing around the search box so that the interface feels polished and easy to scan.
acceptanceCriteria: Search box has visible gap from header
No layout shift or overflow issues

userStories.title: US-006.1: As a CallVault user, I want the folder search to be hidden until I need it so that my sidebar stays clean and uncluttered.
userStories.description: US-006.1: As a CallVault user, I want the folder search to be hidden until I need it so that my sidebar stays clean and uncluttered.
acceptanceCriteria: Magnifying glass icon visible in header
Search auto-hides when cleared and unfocused
Works in both expanded and collapsed sidebar modes
No extra line at top of import screen

userStories.title: US-008.1: As a CallVault user, I want a cleaner integrations section so that I can focus on managing my integrations without visual clutter.
userStories.description: US-008.1: As a CallVault user, I want a cleaner integrations section so that I can focus on managing my integrations without visual clutter.
acceptanceCriteria: Integrations section has reduced visual weight
Design feels cleaner and less boxy
Still clearly grouped as a section
User understands what the date range controls
Consistent wording across all integration types

userStories.title: US-010.1: As a CallVault user importing meetings, I want to easily find and click the Fetch Meetings button so that I can complete the import process.
userStories.description: US-010.1: As a CallVault user importing meetings, I want to easily find and click the Fetch Meetings button so that I can complete the import process.
acceptanceCriteria: Fetch Meetings button visible without scrolling (if possible)
If scrolling required, scroll works correctly
Button accessible on all screen sizes
No content cut off or inaccessible

userStories.title: US-011.1: As a CallVault user, I want consistent icons for each integration so that I can quickly recognize each service regardless of where I am in the app.
userStories.description: US-011.1: As a CallVault user, I want consistent icons for each integration so that I can quickly recognize each service regardless of where I am in the app.

userStories.title: US-012.1: As a CallVault user, I want Connect buttons to look clickable so that I know I can interact with them.
userStories.description: US-012.1: As a CallVault user, I want Connect buttons to look clickable so that I know I can interact with them.
acceptanceCriteria: Connect buttons appear fully active (not grayed)

userStories.title: US-013.1: As a CallVault user connecting an integration, I want to complete the connection with minimal clicks so that I can start using the integration quickly.
userStories.description: US-013.1: As a CallVault user connecting an integration, I want to complete the connection with minimal clicks so that I can start using the integration quickly.
acceptanceCriteria: User can connect faster than before
If no requirements, no acknowledgment checkbox

userStories.title: US-015.1: As a CallVault user, I want to connect my Zoom account so that I can import my Zoom meeting recordings.
userStories.description: US-015.1: As a CallVault user, I want to connect my Zoom account so that I can import my Zoom meeting recordings.

acceptanceCriteria: Fathom alternative shown for restricted users

userStories.description: US-018.1: As a CallVault user connecting Google, I want clear feedback on connection status so that I know if it worked or what went wrong.

acceptanceCriteria: No silent failures or confusing states
